title: Labeled images folder not created in evaluation-results after evalutating trained network
body:
Linux Mint with Anaconda env and deeplabcut 2.0

Hi, I have two issues:

1.
I've re-trained the data (merged with original data + relabeld data using outlier frames + new data), which finished successfully. Then I evaluated the network.

The first time I did this (before re-training), a folder called "LabeledImages_DeepCut_resnet50_TrackHydraJun18shuffle1_1030000_snapshot-1030000" was created under "evaluation-results > iteration 0.  However when I re-trained and evaluated the network, it does not create the folder even with plotting=True parameter. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52329772/60619161-a7abef00-9d9d-11e9-8ce6-a702aaf9cca3.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52329772/60619782-002fbc00-9d9f-11e9-811a-73e86650ce46.png)



So I cannot see the labeled data.

2. 
Also, when I try to re-analyze the videos using the re-trained network, it gives me a message saying "this video has already been analyzed" so it doesn't re-analyze it. After executing "create_labeled_video" command   I checked the folder, but the labeled videos are all the videos from before and not the newly labeled videos.

How could I fix this? 

Thanks in advance.
